values_visible.quote: God is beautiful and he loves that which is beautiful
values_visible.notes: Central theme throughout - beauty in nature, clothing, people, all connecting to divine

values_visible.quote: A true friend is the one whom you may take time away from your family, from your infant, to accompany them in an illness
values_visible.notes: Deep reflection on what makes friendship real

values_visible.quote: I can be conscious and I can choose gratitude
values_visible.notes: Walking meditation, noticing beauty, choosing gratitude

values_visible.quote: I would like to hold him lightly and accept his tears and his cry
values_visible.notes: Buddhist influence via Bhagava - attachment without grasping

values_visible.quote: the simple adornment of the human body which houses the soul... is to honor that which is within us that has the divine

self_awareness.quote: my mind works like this. Not everyone's mind works like this
self_awareness.notes: Explicitly aware his mind moves from topic to topic fluidly

intellectual_patterns: Makes connections between disparate concepts (beauty → gratitude → seasons → conversations)
Philosophical and spiritual integration (Islamic, Buddhist influences)
theory_of_mind.communication_style: spoken/recorded while walking, free-flowing, intimate, self-reflective
theory_of_mind.emotional_intelligence: Very high - deeply reflective about relationships, beauty, meaning

location_context.activity: Walking with baby Sulayman in winter

linguistic_notes.code_switching: Frequent - English narration with French interactions and Arabic prayers
